items.title: Krabzcam
items.description: Some time ago, I revealed I was making Christmas cards using a plotter I built myself (some parts printed by my best boy and colleague Roel). In order to convert vectors to GCode, you need something called CAM processing. This is quite difficult and advanced stuff. I found Krabzcam to make my life significantly easier in this domain, and he decided to put his code open source. I just wanted to take the time and applaud his work!

items.title: Kameleon.be
items.description: Something not tech-related! I bought a pet snake last week and found this amazing shop in Hasselt where they have everything you need for your reptile, rodent, amphibian, spider, ‚Ä¶ So, if you ever are looking for something different as a pet, they have all the stuff you need (and it‚Äôs fun to look at all the animals they have, they are taken care of very well).

items.title: Naddpod
items.description: Looking for a light and entertaining podcast that isn't just a bunch of men talking about their "cool" interests? Not another D&D podcast, the name says it all.

items.title: React Sprout
items.description: Almost every React developer uses React Router for their applications. For all my side-projects, I use React Sprout: a suspense-ready router. React Sprout does also provides a method for data fetching.

author: Wheelhouse
title: Our most random August top picks
introduction: You probably already know the drill! Each month, we pick one thing we love and put it into a list. This list might give you some insight into how people at Wheelhouse think and what intrigues us. This month, we have some technical stuff, snake stuff, and podcast stuff. ü§™
description: Every month we each pick something random that we would like to share to the world. üêç
